greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of set partitions of {1,2,...,n} that have exactly k distinct block sizes.
comment: Row n has floor([sqrt(1+8n)-1]/2) terms (number of terms increases by one at each triangular number). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Feb 26 2012
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..220, flattened
Philippe Flajolet and Robert Sedgewick, Analytic Combinatorics, Cambridge Univ. Press, 2009, page 180.
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; expand(`if`(n=0, 1,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=1..degree(p)))(b(n$2)):
mathematica: nn = 15; p = Product[1 + y (Exp[x^i/i!] - 1), {i, 1, nn}];f[list_] := Select[list, # > 0 &];
Map[f, Drop[ Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[p, {x, 0, nn}], {x, y}], 1]] // Flatten
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 26 2012
